questions.text: A 47-year-old man has been chronically fatigued for the past year. A physical examination yields no abnormal findings. A CBC shows: Hgb 10.8 g/dL, MCV 102 fL, His serum vitamin B12 and folate levels are normal. Which of the following underlying conditions is most likely to explain his findings?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The patient is having macrocytic anemia (MCV= 102) however WBC morphology normal (in megaloblastic you can see hyper segmentation of neutrophils) further B12 and folic acid are normal thus it is neither of those. Ruling out option A (causes B12 deficiency). Important cause of non-megaloblastic causes of macrocytic anemia are liver & thyroid disease. Lead poisoning will lead to microcytic anemia (sideroblastic) with basophilic stipling. Peptic ulcer disease leads to IDA secondary to chronic blood loss.

questions.text: Peripheral blood smear of a child presenting with anemia and jaundice is as follows. Which other manifestation is likely to be seen in this child?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Renal failure. The image shows Schistocytes which are seen in Microangiopathi hemolytic anemia and in children HUS-TTP Is one of the most common cause.

choices.text: A reduced B12/ folic acid levels in the blood

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman has had worsening fatigue for the past 2 months. On physical examination she has an erythematous macular rash on her face. Laboratory studies show Hgb 9.2 g/dL, polychromasia and reticulocyte count is 4.2%. Which of the following is she likely to have?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

  • Anemia; anisocytosis; reticulocytosis and low serum haptoglobin → hemolytic anemia
  • Hemoglobinuria→ intravascular hemolytic anemia
  • Middle aged woman with recent history of malar rash and anemia → SLE→ AIHA → Coombs test for diagnosis
  • Option A- pancytopenia with macrocytic anemia
  • Option B- childhood onsent with splenomegaly and jaundice
  • Option D- PNH

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman has become increasingly fatigued for the past 3 months. There are purpuric areas of skin on her trunk and extremities. She has no hepatosplenomegaly and no lymphadenopathy. Laboratory studies show Hgb 6.8 g/dL, Hct 20.7%, MCV 91 fL, platelet count 28,760/microliter, and WBC count 1940/microliter, retic count 0.5%. Which of the following investigation is the most likely to yield the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Anemia + thrombocytopenia + leucopenia → pancytopenia + reticulocytopenia→ Aplastic anemia → BM examination will diagnose the condition

questions.text: All of the following are increased in iron deficiency anemia except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Transferrin saturation. In IDA serum ferritin, serum iron and transferrin saturation are reduced while options B, C D are increased.

questions.text: In iron excess state in the body liver produces a protein A which decreases protein B in the intestinal epithelial cells. Protein A and B are respectively?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Hepcidin, Ferroportin. In Iron Overload or excess state Hepcidin is produced by liver which induces degradation of ferroportin in intestinal epithelial cells which in turn leads to mucosal block of iron.

questions.text:
Peripheral blood smear of a patient suffering from chronic fatigue and does not like to eat fresh fruits and vegetables is as follows. Which of the following is true about the disease?

 

I. Start B12 and folic acid tablets

II. Methyl melanoic acid in urine is increased

III. MCV > 102

IV. Bald tongue can be clinical manifestation

V. Iron tablets to be started
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

I.III.IV. patient is having megaloblastic anemia ( hypersegmented neutrophils and macrocytes on PBS) and not eating fresh fruits and vegetables→ folic acid deficiency. Option II is seen in vitamin B12 deficiency. Option V in IDA. Folic acid deficiency  should be treated with both Folate and vitamin B12 for risk of having neurological deficits occurring.

questions.text: Splenectomy is treatment of choice in which of the following anemia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Hereditary spherocytosis. In HS there is premature destruction of RBC in spleen due to defect in the cytoskeleton of RBC. Thus doing splenectomy means there is no lysis happening thus is treatment of choice. In AIHA steroids are treatment of choice, in Thalassemia intermittent Blood transfusion and in sickle hydroxyurea are treatment.

questions.text: Match the following RBC inclusions with their causes
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

A-III, B-IV, C-II, D-I

questions.text:
True about G6PD deficiency anemia is/are?

I. There is increase in reduced NADP

II. There is decreased in reduced glutathione

III. There is free radical mediated oxidation of RBC membrane

IV. Heinz bodies are due to oxidation of hemoglobin

V. Autosomal recessive
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

II,III,IV are true. There is decrease in reduced NADP (NADPH) in RBC and G6PD deficiency is X linked recessive disease.

questions.text: Which of the following investigations is required to make a diagnosis of Mycosis Fungoides?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Skin biopsy. Mycosis fungoides is a cutaneous peripheral T cell neoplasm (lymphoma) thus skin biopsy will be diagnostic.

questions.text:
True about Acute lymphoblastic leukaemia is/are

I. B cell type are most common

II. Mostly occur in children

III. Prednisone is used in treatment

IV. Myeloperoxidase positive

V. Agranular cytoplasm in blast
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

I, II, III, V are true myeloperoxidase is positive in myeloid blasts not lymphoid blasts which are positive for Periodic acid schiff.

questions.text: Which of the following blood marker is most important for prognosis in multiple myeloma?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

β-2 microglobulin. β-2 microglobulin & albumin levels are used in staging of myeloma and β-2 microglobulin is most important for staging.

questions.text:
Which of the following translocations are correctly matched with the neoplasms they are most likely seen in

  1.  

i. Inversion (16): Acute Promyelocytic leukaemia

ii. Jak2 mutation: Essential thrombocytosis

iii. T(14;18): Mantle cell lymphoma

iv. T(8;21): chronic myeloid leukaemia

v. T(8;22) : Burkitt lymphoma
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

i,ii,v are true. T(14;18) is seen in follicular lymphoma, mantle cell lymphoma shows 11;14 translocation, t(8;21) is seen in AML M2, CML shows t(9;22).

questions.text:
A 35-year male presents with high grade fever, no lymphadenopathy. Peripheral blood examination shows blasts having granular cytoplasm with occasional auer rods as shown in the image. A bone marrow examination shows dysplasia in myeloid (neutrophilic lineage) and similar blasts of 12%. A cytogenetics shows the blasts are carrying a translocation (8;21). Which of the following is true?

i. This patient is having a myelodysplastic syndrome with excess of blasts

ii. This is not acute myeloid leukaemia because blasts are less than 20%

iii. Good prognostic

iv. Acute myeloid leukaemia is the diagnosis

v. This disease falls under unclassifiable category.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

iii,iv are true. The blasts carry t(8;21), in such case irrespective of the blast count the diagnose is AML. This is a good prognostic type of AML

questions.text: A 11-year child presents with high grade fever and weight loss. Imaging shows a para aortic lymph node mass. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Burkitt lymphoma Lymphnonde mass with B symptoms (fever weight loss) suggest it is a high grade neoplasm. Burkitt presents as abdominal mass. Option A will be supra renal mass, paraganglioma (adrenal or extra adrenal) should have hypertension and adrenal mass, option D presents as thymic mass.

questions.text: In routine annual health check-up in a 55-year male there is a painless cervical lymphnonde enlargement.  There are no other complains and all other examination is normal. Biopsy from lymphnonde shows neoplastic cells positive for CD20, CD10, Bcl-2. What is likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Follicular lymphoma. The patient does not have any other manifestations including B symptoms rules out options A and C (both are high grade should have B symptoms). It is not Hodgkin lymphoma because Hodgkin are CD20 negative.

choices.text: Neoplastic cells are CD20+ B cells

questions.text: Biopsy from cervical lymphnonde is a 34-year-old male is as shown. True about the disease are all except?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Neoplastic cells are CD20+ B cells. The image shows Reed Sternberg cells which is seen in Hodgkin lymphoma, the RS cells are B cells but are CD20 negative thus option A is not true.

questions.text: A 2-year child presents with excessive urination, excessive thirst despite drinking large amounts of fluid the child clinically appears dehydrated. X ray shows lytic lesions in skull. Examination shows it is a neoplastic condition. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Langerhan cell histiocytosis

questions.text: A 40-year male presents with high-grade fever, hepatosplenomegaly. Bone marrow aspirate is as shown in the image. what is the treatment of this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All trans retinoic acid. The image shows blasts with multiple auer rods (Faggot cell) suggestive of Acute promyelocytic leukaemia , which usually carries t (15;17) and all trans retinoic acid is treatment of choice.

questions.text: Which of the following condition presents with pancytopenia with hypercellular marrow and without splenomegaly?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Myelodysplasia. Refer to table below

questions.text: Deficiency of ADAMTS 13 is seen which of the following diseases?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Option A deficiency of→ GPIIB-IIIA, option C→ GPIB-IX, option D Von Willebrand factor.

questions.text: A 25-year young man has a snake bite by the description it looks like a viper. 2 hours later he is having epistaxis hypotension, tachycardia, and rapid breathing. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Disseminated intravascular coagulation. Hypotension with epistaxis is suggestive of bleeding disorder and Russel viper is known to cause DIC.

questions.text: A 2-year girl has recurrent hemarthrosis. CT and APTT are elevated. Which of the following deficiency is it most likely to be?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Von Willebrand Factor

questions.text: Which of the following acts as a hapten molecule in pathogenesis of heparin induced thrombocytopenia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Platelet factor 4. Heparin as such is not antigenic once it binds to PF4 it becomes antigenic and induces antibody formation which leads to destruction of platelets.

questions.text: Gross examination of liver in a patient with Cor pulmonale is as follows. True about the finding in liver is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Red areas are necrotic. This is a chronic venous congestion of liver (not hyperaemia) which leads to haemorrhagic necrosis (red infarct) leading to Nut meg appearance.

questions.text: A 2-year child diagnosed of Christmas disease needs fresh frozen plasma. The slide image of blood grouping is as follows. Which FFP can be given to this child?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

AB +ve or -ve

choices.text: Regular insulin + dextrose infusion before transfusion

questions.text: A 30-year-old man who had a road traffic accident had severe hypovolemia. He was treated with 2 units of P-RBC, 1 unit of FFP and multiple units of normal saline. During transfusion of 3rd unit of P-RBC the emergency physician notes tall T waves with short QT interval on ECG.  Which of the following would be best way to prevent these complications?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The patient underwent a massive blood transfusion and he is having ECG changes suggestive of hyperkalemia, which can be reduced using fresh blood. Option C is for treatment. Option B is for hypothermia, option D is for anaphylaxis

questions.text: Which of the following is false about anemia of chronic disease
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Serum ferritin in high in ACD

questions.text: A 5-year child had fracture femur which was treated with application of cast for 8 weeks. Post cast removal the child complained of pain in the leg and mother gave an oil massage. 3 hours later child complains of chest pain and breathlessness. He was rushed to emergency where he eventually dies. What is the likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Thromboembolism. Immobilisation (cast) is a risk factor for venous thrombosis the patient might have developed thrombosis of lower limbs while immobilisation and massage would have induced embolism to lungs leading to breathless ness and chest pain.
